intro: Diascia elegans, commonly known as the common diascia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces clusters of flowers at the tips of its stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Diascia elegans is known for its long blooming period, often from spring to autumn, adding color to gardens throughout the growing season.
